Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Inventory and Mapping (ID.IM-P): Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.IM-P1: Systems/products/services that process data are inventoried.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Inventory and Mapping (ID.IM-P): Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.IM-P2: Owners or operators (e.g., the organization or third parties such as service providers, partners, customers, and developers) and their roles with respect to the systems/products/services and components (e.g., internal or external) that process data are inventoried.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Inventory and Mapping (ID.IM-P): Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.IM-P3: Categories of individuals (e.g., customers, employees or prospective employees, consumers) whose data are being processed are inventoried.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Inventory and Mapping (ID.IM-P): Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.IM-P4: Data actions of the systems/products/services are inventoried.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Inventory and Mapping (ID.IM-P): Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.IM-P5: The purposes for the data actions are inventoried.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Inventory and Mapping (ID.IM-P): Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.IM-P6: Data elements within the data actions are inventoried.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Inventory and Mapping (ID.IM-P): Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.IM-P7: The data processing environment is identified (e.g., geographic location, internal, cloud, third parties).

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Inventory and Mapping (ID.IM-P): Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.IM-P8: Data processing is mapped, illustrating the data actions and associated data elements for systems/products/services, including components; roles of the component owners/operators; and interactions of individuals or third parties with the systems/products/services.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Business Environment (ID.BE-P): The organization’s mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform privacy roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.BE-P1: The organization’s role(s) in the data processing ecosystem are identified and communicated.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Business Environment (ID.BE-P): The organization’s mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform privacy roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.BE-P2: Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Business Environment (ID.BE-P): The organization’s mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform privacy roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.BE-P3: Systems/products/services that support organizational priorities are identified and key requirements communicated.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Risk Assessment (ID.RA-P): The organization understands the privacy risks to individuals and how such privacy risks may create follow-on impacts on organizational operations, including mission, functions, other risk management priorities (e.g., compliance, financial), reputation, workforce, and culture.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.RA-P1: Contextual factors related to the systems/products/services and the data actions are identified (e.g., individuals’ demographics and privacy interests or perceptions, data sensitivity and/or types, visibility of data processing to individuals and third parties).

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Risk Assessment (ID.RA-P): The organization understands the privacy risks to individuals and how such privacy risks may create follow-on impacts on organizational operations, including mission, functions, other risk management priorities (e.g., compliance, financial), reputation, workforce, and culture.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.RA-P2: Data analytic inputs and outputs are identified and evaluated for bias.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Risk Assessment (ID.RA-P): The organization understands the privacy risks to individuals and how such privacy risks may create follow-on impacts on organizational operations, including mission, functions, other risk management priorities (e.g., compliance, financial), reputation, workforce, and culture.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.RA-P3: Potential problematic data actions and associated problems are identified.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Risk Assessment (ID.RA-P): The organization understands the privacy risks to individuals and how such privacy risks may create follow-on impacts on organizational operations, including mission, functions, other risk management priorities (e.g., compliance, financial), reputation, workforce, and culture.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.RA-P4: Problematic data actions, likelihoods, and impacts are used to determine and prioritize risk.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Risk Assessment (ID.RA-P): The organization understands the privacy risks to individuals and how such privacy risks may create follow-on impacts on organizational operations, including mission, functions, other risk management priorities (e.g., compliance, financial), reputation, workforce, and culture.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.RA-P5: Risk responses are identified, prioritized, and implemented.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Ecosystem Risk Management (ID.DE-P): The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing privacy risk and third parties within the data processing ecosystem. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess, and manage privacy risks within the data processing ecosystem.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.DE-P1: Data processing ecosystem risk management policies, processes, and procedures are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Ecosystem Risk Management (ID.DE-P): The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing privacy risk and third parties within the data processing ecosystem. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess, and manage privacy risks within the data processing ecosystem.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.DE-P2: Data processing ecosystem parties (e.g., service providers, customers, partners, product manufacturers, application developers) are identified, prioritized, and assessed using a privacy risk assessment process.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Ecosystem Risk Management (ID.DE-P): The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing privacy risk and third parties within the data processing ecosystem. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess, and manage privacy risks within the data processing ecosystem.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.DE-P3: Contracts with data processing ecosystem parties are used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of an organization’s privacy program.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Ecosystem Risk Management (ID.DE-P): The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing privacy risk and third parties within the data processing ecosystem. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess, and manage privacy risks within the data processing ecosystem.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.DE-P4: Interoperability frameworks or similar multi-party approaches are used to manage data processing ecosystem privacy risks.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: IDENTIFY-P (ID-P): Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Ecosystem Risk Management (ID.DE-P): The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing privacy risk and third parties within the data processing ecosystem. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess, and manage privacy risks within the data processing ecosystem.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: ID.DE-P5: Data processing ecosystem parties are routinely assessed using audits, test results, or other forms of evaluations to confirm they are meeting their contractual, interoperability framework, or other obligations.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Governance Policies, Processes, and Procedures (GV.PO-P): The policies, processes, and procedures to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.PO-P1: Organizational privacy values and policies (e.g., conditions on data processing such as data uses or retention periods, individuals’ prerogatives with respect to data processing) are established and communicated.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Governance Policies, Processes, and Procedures (GV.PO-P): The policies, processes, and procedures to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.PO-P2: Processes to instill organizational privacy values within system/product/service development and operations are established and in place.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Governance Policies, Processes, and Procedures (GV.PO-P): The policies, processes, and procedures to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.PO-P3: Roles and responsibilities for the workforce are established with respect to privacy.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Governance Policies, Processes, and Procedures (GV.PO-P): The policies, processes, and procedures to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.PO-P4: Privacy roles and responsibilities are coordinated and aligned with third-party stakeholders (e.g., service providers, customers, partners).

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Governance Policies, Processes, and Procedures (GV.PO-P): The policies, processes, and procedures to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.PO-P5: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding privacy are understood and managed.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Governance Policies, Processes, and Procedures (GV.PO-P): The policies, processes, and procedures to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.PO-P6: Governance and risk management policies, processes, and procedures address privacy risks.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Risk Management Strategy (GV.RM-P): The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support operational risk decisions.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.RM-P1: Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Risk Management Strategy (GV.RM-P): The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support operational risk decisions.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.RM-P2: Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Risk Management Strategy (GV.RM-P): The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support operational risk decisions.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.RM-P3: The organization’s determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role(s) in the data processing ecosystem.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Awareness and Training (GV.AT-P): The organization’s workforce and third parties engaged in data processing are provided privacy awareness education and are trained to perform their privacy-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements and organizational privacy values.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.AT-P1: The workforce is informed and trained on its roles and responsibilities.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Awareness and Training (GV.AT-P): The organization’s workforce and third parties engaged in data processing are provided privacy awareness education and are trained to perform their privacy-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements and organizational privacy values.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.AT-P2: Senior executives understand their roles and responsibilities.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Awareness and Training (GV.AT-P): The organization’s workforce and third parties engaged in data processing are provided privacy awareness education and are trained to perform their privacy-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements and organizational privacy values.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.AT-P3: Privacy personnel understand their roles and responsibilities.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Awareness and Training (GV.AT-P): The organization’s workforce and third parties engaged in data processing are provided privacy awareness education and are trained to perform their privacy-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements and organizational privacy values.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.AT-P4: Third parties (e.g., service providers, customers, partners) understand their roles and responsibilities.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Monitoring and Review (GV.MT-P): The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.MT-P1: Privacy risk is re-evaluated on an ongoing basis and as key factors, including the organization’s business environment (e.g., introduction of new technologies), governance (e.g., legal obligations, risk tolerance), data processing, and systems/products/services change.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Monitoring and Review (GV.MT-P): The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.MT-P2: Privacy values, policies, and training are reviewed and any updates are communicated.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Monitoring and Review (GV.MT-P): The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.MT-P3: Policies, processes, and procedures for assessing compliance with legal requirements and privacy policies are established and in place.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Monitoring and Review (GV.MT-P): The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.MT-P4: Policies, processes, and procedures for communicating progress on managing privacy risks are established and in place.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Monitoring and Review (GV.MT-P): The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.MT-P5: Policies, processes, and procedures are established and in place to receive, analyze, and respond to problematic data actions disclosed to the organization from internal and external sources (e.g., internal discovery, privacy researchers, professional events).

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Monitoring and Review (GV.MT-P): The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.MT-P6: Policies, processes, and procedures incorporate lessons learned from problematic data actions.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: GOVERN-P (GV-P): Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Monitoring and Review (GV.MT-P): The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: GV.MT-P7: Policies, processes, and procedures for receiving, tracking, and responding to complaints, concerns, and questions from individuals about organizational privacy practices are established and in place.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Policies, Processes, and Procedures (CT.PO-P): Policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage data processing (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment) consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.PO-P1: Policies, processes, and procedures for authorizing data processing (e.g., organizational decisions, individual consent), revoking authorizations, and maintaining authorizations are established and in place.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Policies, Processes, and Procedures (CT.PO-P): Policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage data processing (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment) consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.PO-P2: Policies, processes, and procedures for enabling data review, transfer, sharing or disclosure, alteration, and deletion are established and in place (e.g., to maintain data quality, manage data retention).

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Policies, Processes, and Procedures (CT.PO-P): Policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage data processing (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment) consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.PO-P3: Policies, processes, and procedures for enabling individuals’ data processing preferences and requests are established and in place.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Policies, Processes, and Procedures (CT.PO-P): Policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage data processing (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment) consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.PO-P4: A data life cycle to manage data is aligned and implemented with the system development life cycle to manage systems.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Management (CT.DM-P): Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DM-P1: Data elements can be accessed for review.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Management (CT.DM-P): Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DM-P2: Data elements can be accessed for transmission or disclosure.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Management (CT.DM-P): Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DM-P3: Data elements can be accessed for alteration.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Management (CT.DM-P): Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DM-P4: Data elements can be accessed for deletion.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Management (CT.DM-P): Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DM-P5: Data are destroyed according to policy.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Management (CT.DM-P): Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DM-P6: Data are transmitted using standardized formats.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Management (CT.DM-P): Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DM-P7: Mechanisms for transmitting processing permissions and related data values with data elements are established and in place.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Management (CT.DM-P): Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DM-P8: Audit/log records are determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed in accordance with policy and incorporating the principle of data minimization.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Management (CT.DM-P): Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DM-P9: Technical measures implemented to manage data processing are tested and assessed.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Management (CT.DM-P): Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DM-P10: Stakeholder privacy preferences are included in algorithmic design objectives and outputs are evaluated against these preferences.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Disassociated Processing (CT.DP-P): Data processing solutions increase disassociability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy and enable implementation of privacy principles (e.g., data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DP-P1: Data are processed to limit observability and linkability (e.g., data actions take place on local devices, privacy-preserving cryptography).

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Disassociated Processing (CT.DP-P): Data processing solutions increase disassociability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy and enable implementation of privacy principles (e.g., data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DP-P2: Data are processed to limit the identification of individuals (e.g., de-identification privacy techniques, tokenization).

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Disassociated Processing (CT.DP-P): Data processing solutions increase disassociability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy and enable implementation of privacy principles (e.g., data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DP-P3: Data are processed to limit the formulation of inferences about individuals’ behavior or activities (e.g., data processing is decentralized, distributed architectures).

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Disassociated Processing (CT.DP-P): Data processing solutions increase disassociability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy and enable implementation of privacy principles (e.g., data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DP-P4: System or device configurations permit selective collection or disclosure of data elements.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: CONTROL-P (CT-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Disassociated Processing (CT.DP-P): Data processing solutions increase disassociability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy and enable implementation of privacy principles (e.g., data minimization).
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CT.DP-P5: Attribute references are substituted for attribute values.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: COMMUNICATE-P (CM-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Communication Policies, Processes, and Procedures (CM.PO-P): Policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used to increase transparency of the organization’s data processing practices (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment) and associated privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CM.PO-P1: Transparency policies, processes, and procedures for communicating data processing purposes, practices, and associated privacy risks are established and in place.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: COMMUNICATE-P (CM-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Communication Policies, Processes, and Procedures (CM.PO-P): Policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used to increase transparency of the organization’s data processing practices (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment) and associated privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CM.PO-P2: Roles and responsibilities (e.g., public relations) for communicating data processing purposes, practices, and associated privacy risks are established.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: COMMUNICATE-P (CM-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Awareness (CM.AW-P): Individuals and organizations have reliable knowledge about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, and effective mechanisms are used and maintained to increase predictability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CM.AW-P1: Mechanisms (e.g., notices, internal or public reports) for communicating data processing purposes, practices, associated privacy risks, and options for enabling individuals’ data processing preferences and requests are established and in place.

Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Awareness (CM.AW-P): Individuals and organizations have reliable knowledge about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, and effective mechanisms are used and maintained to increase predictability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: CM.AW-P2: Mechanisms for obtaining feedback from individuals (e.g., surveys or focus groups) about data processing and associated privacy risks are established and in place.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: COMMUNICATE-P (CM-P): Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Processing Awareness (CM.AW-P): Individuals and organizations have reliable knowledge about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, and effective mechanisms are used and maintained to increase predictability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: PROTECT-P (PR-P): Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Protection Policies, Processes, and Procedures (PR.PO-P): Security and privacy policies (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment), processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage the protection of data.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: PROTECT-P (PR-P): Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: PROTECT-P (PR-P): Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AC-P): Access to data and devices is limited to authorized individuals, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: PR.AC-P1: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized individuals, processes, and devices.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: PROTECT-P (PR-P): Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.

Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: PR.AC-P2: Physical access to data and devices is managed.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: PROTECT-P (PR-P): Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: PROTECT-P (PR-P): Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.

Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: PR.AC-P6: Individuals and devices are proofed and bound to credentials, and authenticated commensurate with the risk of the transaction (e.g., individuals’ security and privacy risks and other organizational risks).

Privacy Framework Core.Function: PROTECT-P (PR-P): Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Data Security (PR.DS-P): Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy and maintain data confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: PR.DS-P1: Data-at-rest are protected.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: PROTECT-P (PR-P): Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Maintenance (PR.MA-P): System maintenance and repairs are performed consistent with policies, processes, and procedures.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: PR.MA-P1: Maintenance and repair of organizational assets are performed and logged, with approved and controlled tools.

Privacy Framework Core.Category: Maintenance (PR.MA-P): System maintenance and repairs are performed consistent with policies, processes, and procedures.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: PR.MA-P2: Remote maintenance of organizational assets is approved, logged, and performed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: PROTECT-P (PR-P): Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Protective Technology (PR.PT-P): Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems/products/services and associated data, consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements.
Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: PR.PT-P1: Removable media is protected and its use restricted according to policy.

Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: PR.PT-P2: The principle of least functionality is incorporated by configuring systems to provide only essential capabilities.

Privacy Framework Core.Subcategory: PR.PT-P3: Communications and control networks are protected.

Privacy Framework Core.Function: PROTECT-P (PR-P): Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Privacy Framework Core.Category: Protective Technology (PR.PT-P): Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems/products/services and associated data, consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements.
